org.apache.juneau.rest.annotation

Annotation Type RestGet


  • @Target(value=METHOD)
 @Retention(value=RUNTIME)
 @Inherited
 @ContextApply(value=RestGetAnnotation.RestOpContextApply.class)
 @AnnotationGroup(value=RestOp.class)
public @interface RestGet
    Identifies a REST GET operation Java method on a RestServlet implementation class.

    This is a specialized subtype of @RestOp(method=GET).

    • Overview > juneau-rest-server > @RestOp-Annotated Methods
    • Source

    • Element Detail

      • clientVersion

        public abstract String clientVersion
        Specifies whether this method can be called based on the client version.

        The client version is identified via the HTTP request header identified by @Rest(clientVersionHeader) which by default is "Client-Version".

        This is a specialized kind of RestMatcher that allows you to invoke different Java methods for the same method/path based on the client version.

        The format of the client version range is similar to that of OSGi versions.

        In the following example, the Java methods are mapped to the same HTTP method and URL "/foobar".

        // Call this method if Client-Version is at least 2.0. // Note that this also matches 2.0.1. @RestGet(path="/foobar", clientVersion="2.0") public Object method1() {...} // Call this method if Client-Version is at least 1.1, but less than 2.0. @RestGet(path="/foobar", clientVersion="[1.1,2.0)") public Object method2() {...} // Call this method if Client-Version is less than 1.1. @RestGet(path="/foobar", clientVersion="[0,1.1)") public Object method3() {...}

        It's common to combine the client version with transforms that will convert new POJOs into older POJOs for backwards compatibility.

        // Call this method if Client-Version is at least 2.0. @RestGet(path="/foobar", clientVersion="2.0") public NewPojo newMethod() {...} // Call this method if Client-Version is at least 1.1, but less than 2.0. @RestGet(path="/foobar", clientVersion="[1.1,2.0)") @BeanConfig(swaps=NewToOldSwap.class) public NewPojo oldMethod() { return newMethod(); }

        Note that in the previous example, we're returning the exact same POJO, but using a transform to convert it into an older form. The old method could also just return back a completely different object. The range can be any of the following:

        • "[0,1.0)" = Less than 1.0. 1.0 and 1.0.0 does not match.
        • "[0,1.0]" = Less than or equal to 1.0. Note that 1.0.1 will match.
        • "1.0" = At least 1.0. 1.0 and 2.0 will match.
        • RestContext.Builder.clientVersionHeader(String)
        Returns:
        The annotation value.
        Default:
        ""

      • contextClass

        public abstract Class<? extends RestOpContext> contextClass
        Allows you to extend the RestOpContext class to modify how any of the methods are implemented.
        • RestOpContext.Builder.type(Class)
        Returns:
        The annotation value.
        Default:

      • converters

        public abstract Class<? extends RestConverter>[] converters
        Class-level response converters.

        Associates one or more converters with this method.

        • RestOpContext.Builder.converters() - Registering converters with REST resources.
        Returns:
        The annotation value.
        Default:
        {}

      • debug

        public abstract String debug
        Enable debug mode.

        Enables the following:

        • HTTP request/response bodies are cached in memory for logging purposes.
        • Request/response messages are automatically logged.
        • "true" - Debug is enabled for all requests.
        • "false" - Debug is disabled for all requests.
        • "conditional" - Debug is enabled only for requests that have a Debug: true header.
        • "" (or anything else) - Debug mode is inherited from class.
        • Supports Overview > juneau-rest-server > SVL Variables (e.g. "$L{my.localized.variable}").
        • RestContext.Builder.debugEnablement()
        Returns:
        The annotation value.
        Default:
        ""

      • defaultAccept

        public abstract String defaultAccept
        Default Accept header.

        The default value for the Accept header if not specified on a request.

        This is a shortcut for using defaultRequestHeaders() for just this specific header.

        Returns:
        The annotation value.
        Default:
        ""

      • defaultCharset

        public abstract String defaultCharset
        Default character encoding.

        The default character encoding for the request and response if not specified on the request.

        • Supports Overview > juneau-rest-server > SVL Variables (e.g. "$S{mySystemProperty}").
        • RestContext.Builder.defaultCharset(Charset)
        • RestOpContext.Builder.defaultCharset(Charset)
        • Rest.defaultCharset()
        Returns:
        The annotation value.
        Default:
        ""

      • defaultRequestQueryData

        public abstract String[] defaultRequestQueryData
        Specifies default values for query parameters.

        Strings are of the format "name=value".

        Affects values returned by RestRequest.getQueryParam(String) when the parameter is not present on the request.

        Example:

        @RestGet(path="/*", defaultRequestQueryData={"foo=bar"}) public String doGet(@Query("foo") String foo) {...}

        • You can use either ':' or '=' as the key/value delimiter.
        • Key and value is trimmed of whitespace.
        • Supports Overview > juneau-rest-server > SVL Variables (e.g. "$S{mySystemProperty}").
        Returns:
        The annotation value.
        Default:
        {}

      • defaultRequestAttributes

        public abstract String[] defaultRequestAttributes
        Default request attributes.

        Specifies default values for request attributes if they're not already set on the request.

        Affects values returned by the following methods:

        • RestRequest.getAttribute(String).
        • RestRequest.getAttributes().
        Example:

        // Defined via annotation resolving to a config file setting with default value. @Rest(defaultRequestAttributes={"Foo=bar", "Baz: $C{REST/myAttributeValue}"}) public class MyResource { // Override at the method level. @RestGet(defaultRequestAttributes={"Foo: bar"}) public Object myMethod() {...} }

      • Supports Overview > juneau-rest-server > SVL Variables (e.g. "$L{my.localized.variable}").
      • RestContext.Builder.defaultRequestAttributes(NamedAttribute...)
      • Rest.defaultRequestAttributes()
Returns:
The annotation value.
Default:
{}

    • defaultRequestHeaders

      public abstract String[] defaultRequestHeaders
      Default request headers.

      Specifies default values for request headers if they're not passed in through the request.

      Example:

      // Assume "text/json" Accept value when Accept not specified @RestGet(path="/*", defaultRequestHeaders={"Accept: text/json"}) public String doGet() {...}

      • Supports Overview > juneau-rest-server > SVL Variables (e.g. "$S{mySystemProperty}").
      • RestContext.Builder.defaultRequestHeaders(org.apache.http.Header...)
      Returns:
      The annotation value.
      Default:
      {}

    • defaultResponseHeaders

      public abstract String[] defaultResponseHeaders
      Default response headers.

      Specifies default values for response headers if they're not overwritten during the request.

      Example:

      // Assume "text/json" Accept value when Accept not specified @RestGet(path="/*", defaultResponseHeaders={"Content-Type: text/json"}) public String doGet() {...}

      • Supports Overview > juneau-rest-server > SVL Variables (e.g. "$S{mySystemProperty}").
      • RestContext.Builder.defaultResponseHeaders(org.apache.http.Header...)
      Returns:
      The annotation value.
      Default:
      {}

    • description

      public abstract String[] description
      Optional description for the exposed API.

      This description is used in the following locations:

      • The value returned by Operation.getDescription() in the auto-generated swagger.
      • The "$RS{operationDescription}" variable.
      • The description of the method in the Swagger page.
      • Corresponds to the swagger field /paths/{path}/{method}/description.
      • Supports Overview > juneau-rest-server > SVL Variables (e.g. "$L{my.localized.variable}").
      Returns:
      The annotation value.
      Default:
      {}

    • encoders

      public abstract Class<? extends Encoder>[] encoders
      Specifies the compression encoders for this method.

      Encoders are used to enable various kinds of compression (e.g. "gzip") on requests and responses.

      This value overrides encoders specified at the class level using Rest.encoders(). The EncoderSet.Inherit class can be used to include values from the parent class.

      Example:

      // Define a REST resource that handles GZIP compression. @Rest( encoders={ GzipEncoder.class } ) public class MyResource { // Define a REST method that can also use a custom encoder. @RestGet( method=GET, encoders={ EncoderSet.Inherit.class, MyEncoder.class } ) public MyBean doGet() { ... } }

      The programmatic equivalent to this annotation is:

      RestOpContext.Builder builder = RestOpContext.create(method,restContext); builder.getEncoders().set(classes);

      • Overview > juneau-rest-server > Encoders
      Returns:
      The annotation value.
      Default:
      {}

    • guards

      public abstract Class<? extends RestGuard>[] guards
      Method-level guards.

      Associates one or more RestGuards with this method.

      • RestOpContext.Builder.guards()
      Returns:
      The annotation value.
      Default:
      {}

    • matchers

      public abstract Class<? extends RestMatcher>[] matchers
      Method matchers.

      Associates one more more RestMatchers with this method.

      Matchers are used to allow multiple Java methods to handle requests assigned to the same URL path pattern, but differing based on some request attribute, such as a specific header value.

      • RestMatcher
      Returns:
      The annotation value.
      Default:
      {}

    • on

      Returns:
      The annotation value.
      Default:
      {}

    • path

      public abstract String[] path
      Optional path pattern for the specified method.

      Appending "/*" to the end of the path pattern will make it match any remainder too.
      Not appending "/*" to the end of the pattern will cause a 404 (Not found) error to occur if the exact pattern is not found.

      The path can contain variables that get resolved to @Path parameters.

      Examples:

      @RestGet(path="/myurl/{foo}/{bar}/{baz}/*")

      @RestGet(path="/myurl/{0}/{1}/{2}/*")

      Note that you can also use value() to specify the path.

      • Path
      Returns:
      The annotation value.
      Default:
      {}

    • produces

      public abstract String[] produces
      Supported accept media types.

      Overrides the media types inferred from the serializers that identify what media types can be produced by the resource.

      • Supports Overview > juneau-rest-server > SVL Variables (e.g. "$S{mySystemProperty}").
      • RestOpContext.Builder.produces(MediaType...)
      Returns:
      The annotation value.
      Default:
      {}

    • roleGuard

      public abstract String roleGuard
      Role guard.

      An expression defining if a user with the specified roles are allowed to access this method.

      Example:

      public class MyResource extends BasicRestServlet implements BasicUniversalConfig { @RestGet( path="/foo", roleGuard="ROLE_ADMIN || (ROLE_READ_WRITE && ROLE_SPECIAL)" ) public Object doGet() { } }

      • Supports any of the following expression constructs:
        • "foo" - Single arguments.
        • "foo,bar,baz" - Multiple OR'ed arguments.
        • "foo | bar | baz" - Multiple OR'ed arguments, pipe syntax.
        • "foo || bar || baz" - Multiple OR'ed arguments, Java-OR syntax.
        • "fo*" - Patterns including '*' and '?'.
        • "fo* & *oo" - Multiple AND'ed arguments, ampersand syntax.
        • "fo* && *oo" - Multiple AND'ed arguments, Java-AND syntax.
        • "fo* || (*oo || bar)" - Parenthesis.
      • AND operations take precedence over OR operations (as expected).
      • Whitespace is ignored.
      • null or empty expressions always match as false.
      • If patterns are used, you must specify the list of declared roles using rolesDeclared() or RestOpContext.Builder.rolesDeclared(String...).
      • Supports Overview > juneau-rest-server > SVL Variables (e.g. "$L{my.localized.variable}").
      • When defined on parent/child classes and methods, ALL guards within the hierarchy must pass.
      • RestOpContext.Builder.roleGuard(String)
      Returns:
      The annotation value.
      Default:
      ""

    • rolesDeclared

      public abstract String rolesDeclared
      Declared roles.

      A comma-delimited list of all possible user roles.

      Used in conjunction with roleGuard() is used with patterns.

      Example:

      public class MyResource extends BasicRestServlet implements BasicUniversalConfig { @RestGet( path="/foo", rolesDeclared="ROLE_ADMIN,ROLE_READ_WRITE,ROLE_READ_ONLY,ROLE_SPECIAL", roleGuard="ROLE_ADMIN || (ROLE_READ_WRITE && ROLE_SPECIAL)" ) public Object doGet() { } }

      • RestOpContext.Builder.rolesDeclared(String...)
      Returns:
      The annotation value.
      Default:
      ""

    • serializers

      public abstract Class<? extends Serializer>[] serializers
      Specifies the serializers for marshalling POJOs into response bodies for this method.

      Serializer are used to convert POJOs to HTTP response bodies.
      Any of the Juneau framework serializers can be used in this setting.
      The serializer selected is based on the request Accept header matched against the values returned by the following method using a best-match algorithm:

      • Serializer.getMediaTypeRanges()

      This value overrides serializers specified at the class level using Rest.serializers(). The SerializerSet.Inherit class can be used to include values from the parent class.

      Example:

      // Define a REST resource that can produce JSON and HTML. @Rest( serializers={ JsonParser.class, HtmlParser.class } ) public class MyResource { // Define a REST method that can also produce XML. @RestGet( parsers={ SerializerSet.Inherit.class, XmlParser.class } ) public MyBean doGet() { ... } }

      The programmatic equivalent to this annotation is:

      RestOpContext.Builder builder = RestOpContext.create(method,restContext); builder.getSerializers().set(classes);

      • Overview > juneau-rest-server > Marshalling
      Returns:
      The annotation value.
      Default:
      {}

    • summary

      public abstract String summary
      Optional summary for the exposed API.

      This summary is used in the following locations:

      • The value returned by Operation.getSummary() in the auto-generated swagger.
      • The "$RS{operationSummary}" variable.
      • The summary of the method in the Swagger page.
      • Corresponds to the swagger field /paths/{path}/{method}/summary.
      • Supports Overview > juneau-rest-server > SVL Variables (e.g. "$L{my.localized.variable}").
      Returns:
      The annotation value.
      Default:
      ""

    • swagger

      public abstract OpSwagger swagger
      Provides swagger-specific metadata on this method.

      Used to populate the auto-generated OPTIONS swagger documentation.

      The format of this annotation is JSON when all individual parts are concatenated.
      The starting and ending '{'/'}' characters around the entire value are optional.

      Example:

      @RestGet( path="/{propertyName}", // Swagger info. swagger={ "parameters:[", "{name:'propertyName',in:'path',description:'The system property name.'},", "{in:'body',description:'The new system property value.'}", "],", "responses:{", "302: {headers:{Location:{description:'The root URL of this resource.'}}},", "403: {description:'User is not an admin.'}", "}" } )

      • The format is Overview > juneau-dto > Swagger.
        Multiple lines are concatenated with newlines.
      • The starting and ending '{'/'}' characters around the entire value are optional.
      • These values are superimposed on top of any Swagger JSON file present for the resource in the classpath.
      • Supports Overview > juneau-rest-server > SVL Variables (e.g. "$L{my.localized.variable}").
      • OpSwagger
      • SwaggerProvider
      Returns:
      The annotation value.
      Default:
      @org.apache.juneau.rest.annotation.OpSwagger

    • value

      public abstract String value
      REST method path.

      Can be used to provide a shortened form for the path() value.

      The following examples are considered equivalent.

      // Normal form @RestGet(path="/{propertyName}") // Shortened form @RestGet("/{propertyName}")

      Returns:
      The annotation value.
      Default:
      ""
